result.name: ukeof-environmental-observation-activity-catalogue
result.notes: The UK Environmental Observation Framework (UKEOF) works to improve coordination of the observational evidence needed to understand and manage the changing natural environment. It is a partnership of public sector organisations with an interest in using and providing evidence from environmental observations.  UKEOF coordinates the Environmental Observation Activity Catalogue, which aims to hold information on all of the environmental observations undertaken by or for the UK by the public sector. The catalogue also holds metadata on a number of voluntary organisations observation programmes and has the potential to include observations made by private organisations.  The catalogue currently contains a list of over 1200 observations which involve over 200 organisations.  UKEOF works closely with UKDMOS who provide information about all UK marine monitoring activities for inclusion which ensures a full suite of environmental observations can be explored.

organization.name: united-kingdom-environmental-observation-monitoring-programmes
organization.title: United Kingdom Environmental Observation Monitoring Programmes

result.title: UKEOF Environmental Observation Activity Catalogue

extras.value: ["Metadata about environmental observation activities is publicly available.  There may be some access restriction to certain monitoring sites for purposes of security and confidentiality"]

         <gmd:abstract>
				        <gco:CharacterString>The UK Environmental Observation Framework (UKEOF) works to improve coordination of the observational evidence needed to understand and manage the changing natural environment. It is a partnership of public sector organisations with an interest in using and providing evidence from environmental observations.  UKEOF coordinates the Environmental Observation Activity Catalogue, which aims to hold information on all of the environmental observations undertaken by or for the UK by the public sector. The catalogue also holds metadata on a number of voluntary organisations observation programmes and has the potential to include observations made by private organisations.  The catalogue currently contains a list of over 1200 observations which involve over 200 organisations.  UKEOF works closely with UKDMOS who provide information about all UK marine monitoring activities for inclusion which ensures a full suite of environmental observations can be explored.  
</gco:CharacterString>
			      </gmd:abstract>

      <gmd:DQ_DataQuality>
         <gmd:scope>
            <gmd:DQ_Scope>
               <gmd:level>

         </gmd:scope>
         <gmd:lineage>
            <gmd:LI_Lineage>
               <gmd:statement>
                  <gco:CharacterString>Information contained in the catalogue originally came from the 2006 ERFF Monitoring Questionnaire. In 2009 the 13 major UK-EOF sponsors updated their information, it was translated into a database and a search facility made available online.  In 2010 a wide scale update was undertaken. Over 100 organisations were asked to check add and/ or update their catalogue records. Information contained within the JNCC Terrestrial Surveillance Monitoring Database and the UK Directory of Marine Observing Systems (UKDMOS) was also incorporated. As of August 2011, the catalogue holds information about 1150 programmes, activities and data sources.</gco:CharacterString>
               </gmd:statement>
            </gmd:LI_Lineage>
         </gmd:lineage>
      </gmd:DQ_DataQuality>
   </gmd:dataQualityInfo>
